page.title: 19TENANT FARMING IN ROMSEY
page.content: For Mr Dovey, a Romsey tenant farmer, work begins at 7 am. He rents 300 acres of land from Broadlands Estate. Twenty years ago it cost Â£5 per acre a year, now it costs Â£35. He has worked on Sparshot Farm all his life and will inherit the tenancy from his father. He grows winter and spring barley, hay and 15 acres of peas. Mr Dovey once had about 170 dairy cows but he has switched to beef cattle. He has woodland where pheasants are bred for shooting parties. Some of Mr Dovey's land was a gravel pit but it has now been filled in and the ground is used for poor grazing. The oldest of his farm buildings was built in the late 1800's. He had a cow barn built in 1960 for a cost of Â£6,000 - now it would cost Â£60,000. He no longer has regular employees but hires casual labour for haymaking.
